description: Dalai Lama  was live. Meeting with USIP Youth Leaders - Day 2 part 2: His Holiness the Dalai Lama and United States Institute of Peace Youth Leaders discuss positive solutions happening in conflict areas around the world at His Holiness's residence in Dharamsala, HP, India on November 6-7, 2017.  Day 2 part 1 can be viewed at  https://www.facebook.com/DalaiLama/videos/10155116603907616/  All times Indian Standard Time (IST=GST+5.30)  November 6th: 9:00am - 11:30am IST  November 7th: 10:00am - 11:30am IST Jon Wiebke Domianus

Scott Olson  shared  Institute for New Economic Thinking 's  video . Centre for International Governance Innovation (CIGI) Joseph E. Stiglitz Michael Spence Lord Adair Turner Winnie Byanyima Mohamed A. El-Erian

comments.content: I think ideas from out off economists circle should be considered, since they are the ones affected by policies generated by economists and implemented by Govts.  We all know it is a failure.  We need to be heard and given fair chance to prove we are right with our thoughts and not drowned by commissions voice/noise and cowed down by the power of funding.
More cooperation with communities and the environment would be a great start.  The theory of economics built on a model of poor morality and scarcity is brainwashing and destroying the world.

To have a new economic thinking the key issue is to acknowledge the fundamental roles of energy and non renewable ressources as limiting factors to growth. It is urgent to admit that mainstream economics and our societal model based on continued depletion of non renewable resources are not only obsolete, but leading us to global collapse and mass extinction in the near future.

description: Institute for New Economic Thinking We are pleased to announce the launch of a Commission on Global Economic Transformation (CGET), with support from the  Centre for International Governance Innovation (CIGI) .   Co-chaired by Nobel laureates  Joseph E. Stiglitz  and  Michael Spence , it is the first commission of its kind, initiated at a critical moment for the global economy. It will tackle issues from macroeconomic balances to rethinking globalization, and from climate change to technology and the future of work. Fellow Commissioners include INET President Rob Johnson,  Lord Adair Turner , Nelson Barbosa, Kaushik Basu, Peter Bofinger,  Winnie Byanyima ,  Mohamed A. El-Erian , Dr Gaël Giraud, James Manyika, Rohinton Medhora, Danny Quah, Dani Rodrik, Eisuke Sakakibara, Yu Yongding.   Stay tuned for more discussions and presentations from  # INET2017 !  Learn more about CGET at:  bit.ly/2h3ovz9 Christian Felber Nick Rough Mira Mce
